page.title: 20SMEATHARPE - THE RUSTIC LIFE
page.content: It is a cultural shock for the town person who comes to live in the country. No - there really is no bus, no pub, and no fish and chip shop! However, soon other facets of country life begin to shine. At first many things seem rather quaint - the Village Fete or Harvest Home. When they are able to be in- volved and feel part of (rather than bemused by) country life, they are no longer newcomers. Many townpeople may feel more worldly- wise than their rustic neighbours. Perhaps they are, but they may learn to respect the knowledge of the count- ryside and the neighbourliness which people born in the country often have. Rural life - one man's meat but another man's poison! This contribution was made by the mem- bers of Smeatharpe Women's Institute.
